pyELIJAH.detection.machine_learning.ModelML module

class pyELIJAH.detection.machine_learning.ModelML.ModelML(output_folder, ML_type, kernel='', degree_poly=4, data_shape=100, n_hidden_layers=1, n_neurons=1, dropout_rate=0.05, epoch=50, steps_per_epoch=None, batch_size=32, kernel_size=3, pool_size=2)[source]

Bases: object

Model ML class containing the arguments and methods to generate ML models, train them and test them.

build_model()[source]

This function builds the model used for the machine learning detection. There are 3 possibilities:

  • SVM, using scikit-learn SVC https://scikit-learn.org/dev/modules/generated/sklearn.svm.SVC.html

  • NN, using tensorflow NN https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/quickstart/beginner

  • CNN, using tensorflow CNN https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/images/cnn

    also https://medium.com/@mayankverma05032001/binary-classification-using-convolution-neural-network-cnn-model-6e35cdf5bdbb

predict(X, Y_results=None, label='')[source]

This function predicts the class labels for the given data

Parameters:

  • X – array of elements used to derive the label from the trained model

  • Y_results – array of labels to che k the model results, if provided

train(X, Y)[source]

This function trains the model

Parameters:

  • X – array of elements used to train the model

  • Y – labels of the training data

pyELIJAH.detection.machine_learning.machine_learning_yaml module

pyELIJAH.detection.machine_learning.machine_learning_yaml.machine_learning(input_data_folder, output_data_folder, ml_model, params_list)[source]

Machine Learning function used to detect exoplanets

Parameters:

  • input_data_folder (str) – Path to the folder containing the training data

  • output_data_folder (str) – Path to the folder where to save the output data

  • params_list (list of parameters obj) – Object containing list of model parameters

  • ml_model (str) – Machine Learning model decided

Module contents

A module used to detect exoplanets of a dataset using machine learning algorithms
